main_definition: To carefully choose or pick out something from a group based on specific criteria.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To choose deliberately, particularly for an important purpose or event.
meanings_and_examples.example: She will select her outfit for the wedding.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To pick out from a larger group based on certain qualities or characteristics.
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee will select finalists from hundreds of applicants.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To use with special equipment to identify something, often in the context of data analysis or research.
meanings_and_examples.example: Scientists will select a random sample from the population for their study.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To exercise control over which items are kept and discarded. This term is commonly used when referring to sorting mail or packages, or choosing stocks in investing.
meanings_and_examples.example: The post office will select the letters that need special handling for international delivery.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To choose from a group of options with some restrictions or conditions applied.
meanings_and_examples.example: She can only select two colors to paint her room, blue and green.
